column2: In touch with the ground. On the hunt.
We are the hunters, not the hunted.
The hunter takes his prey, the law of the nature he obeys.
There is an art to warfare that requires practice.
A prudent ruler allows for times of shortage in all things, even the simplest.
Only the richest Tyrian purple is worthy of an emperor.
He is the warmth and light of the sun; the truth of what will be.
The salmon of wisdom calls to fishermen.
Grain feeds the city; well-fed men do their betters' bidding.
Legionaries must be housed and trained, so that they may stand in harm's way.
Great builders, working for the glory of their gods and people.
The earliest of spectator sports, wrestling is an ancient tradition.
May your horn sound the charge but never the retreat.
Zeus Ammon is widely revered by Greeks and Egyptians.
Horus, bringer of the dawn and of wisdom, gives much to the people.
An established village, growing by hard toil and devout effort.
Let lesser people, not Romans, build in wood.
All who seek glory in battle should honour Andraste.
For great rulers, death is a reminder of greatness.
More than a man's fate may be read from the linden tree.
The worship of the mother, beloved of her people, brings bounty to the tribes.
The sea is a fluid border.
The shrewd trader shares arak and renews old friendships before the purse is opened.
Those who hope for strong sons honour Fraujaz.
There may be abundance now, but who knows what hardships the gods may send our way\?
Joy and love, truth and justice: all are celebrated.
With careful planning water brings abundance.
Raw materials for the advancement and magnificence of Rome.
“This gem contains a fly that Achilles swatted at the gates of Troy, you know...”
Hephaistos is patron of smithing and sculpture, and men do well to honour his works.
Honouring Mars brings a martial spirit to the city.
The white stallion heads towards the eternal pastures.
Artisans and skilled labourers, working and shaping stone in-situ.
Praise be to Zeus Ammon, father of Alexander.
Regular practice and training conditions both riders and horses for war.
There is an art to skirmishing that requires practice.
Give honour to Imhotep, wisest of the wise, and healer of healers!
Controlling water levels and flow to uncover ore veins.
A spear and a shield is all it takes to lay criminals low.
When you need to quickly gather a crew, even humble quarters will suffice.
The river of money flows through this place on its way to the Imperial treasury.
The wisdom of Epona is shared with those who do her honour.
From tiny acorns great oaks grow.
Blacksmiths forged the ancient world, in bronze, iron and steel.
Merchants and trade flourish where Melqart is honoured.
Egyptians and Greeks can worship Serapis in equality.
Wind and wave are his to command.
Oh, Zalmoxis! Receive our messenger, delivered at spearpoint.
Where civilisation is born.
Where the waters flow, life flourishes.
To bend water to our will is a great power indeed.
The fire god Hephaistos helps those workers who honour him.
A shining centre of politics, religion and trade for the people.
Pay your respects to all the gods and they shall bless you in return.
The trumpet is given shape to match its roar.
The worship of Imhotep, Brother of Thoth, is a righteous path to wisdom and healing.
From the city walls to the shore and beyond, we extend our power.
A shrine to Melqart, the god of trade and the underworld.
Once dried and salted, fish can be traded far and wide.
Fear the might of the fire god dwelling in the heart of the volcano.
What cannot be bought is not worth buying.
A flourishing province brings its governor prosperity.
Toutatis offers his protection to those who honour him.
The work of a marine is never over.
Animals require large areas of land to be given over for their care.
Water is life, and it pays to guard it as you would your own.
Sea legs can be found when there is glory and gold to be gained.
The man who can read sees beyond the horizon.
Listen to the father of the gods and learn much of what should be…
Spoils could be worse spent than in modest tribute to a worthy god.
Expertise comes only with diligent practice.
The home of the fleet, where mastery of the sea is planned.
The design of grand edifices and temples dedicated to the gods.
Like the sun, coins sustain life.
In an ugly world, beauty dictates value.
Many voices raised as one: the voice of the people.
Serapis will help those who honour him properly.
'The Great Provider' watches over the faithful.
This mighty temple to Neptune ensures that all enterprises at sea go well.
Is there anything more exciting than a day at the races\?
Cavalry require serious training to attack and manoeuvre on the field.
Whipped with rods, burned by fire, and taught to handle the blade.
Armour is not cowardice. Every stroke turned aside weakens the foe.
Honour the father of the gods and earn his protection.
A gateway to the world, the colonies, trade and to war's terrors.
Destiny is shaped by breeze and branch.
Safe haven from pirates and storms, and a place to trade.
Born or sold into service, the plight of slaves remains the same.
Pens. For cattle.
A garrison's stability nurtures a growing town.
The rose hue of these buildings is a unique sight.
The strongest river is a force without equal, carrying life and strength before it.
Poseidon rules the deeps, shakes the earth, and is master of horses. No sensible man ignores him.
The god of smiths should be honoured by all honest toiling folk.
Knowledge and inspiration inform and enhance one another.
All praise to Hathor, goddess of love and motherhood, and Maat, weigher of the soul.
Honour his memory and you honour your people.
In honour of Sardus, in the hope of his continued favour.
The hero who gave his life and name to the land.
A well-trained horse is worth its weight in cattle.
When food is plentiful there is money to be made in cattle.
The gods need a place to call their own.
All a man could want is within.
Shaped and prepared stone for construction or sale.
Raw materials for great monuments and structures.
Knowledge and philosophy feed the soul.
The spring is proof of the Mother’s love for her children.
The voices of the gods are heard more clearly in the open air.
For settlers and traders, towns are home to opportunities undreamt of in villages.
Controlling water flow to scour the soil and reveal deposits.
The wise man obeys the law, or pays the price.
A strong tribe deserves a strong home.
Whispers of history and myth, within which the Muses speak to us.
Granite and marble, alabaster and diorite, to construct the civilised world.
The mighty Dhu Shara, chief among the gods, must have a suitable home.
The lord of the mountain, ruler of gods and men alike, demands reverence.
A great colonnade, where grain merchants can ply their trade.
If it walks upon four legs, the discerning gourmand can find it here.
For most people, their village is the whole world.
Noble horses are fitting mounts for the best of cavalrymen.
Full of life and opportunity, the greatest city forever reinvents itself.
A centre of trade, politics and military power, bringing glory to the people.
When the night falls, loneliness calls.
A harbour is a gateway to the world of trade and military adventure.
Stern-faced Mamers should be suitably honoured by such a warlike people.
Honouring Mars brings a martial spirit to the tribes.
The forges turn out arms and armour in great numbers.
Managing water is vital for survival during droughts and sieges.
The cold of the great North emanates from the stones themselves.
A beacon in the darkness, bringing light and order to the world.
The sun can be made to shine its light upon your life.
A doorway beyond the mortal realm, home to nymphs and lesser gods…
Many hands make light work.
A tree grows branches, a city grows streets.
Once founded, a city needs protection.
The capital is the hub around which the entire state rotates.
Streets bustling with activity are a sure sign of grandeur.
It's no surprise that the people here think all outsiders inferior.
Even the gods would be proud to live in such a city.
Small towns breed ambitious men.
Through his knowledge the smiths make weapons to protect our people.
The working day starts at dawn and ends at sunset.
Look after your land and enjoy its gratitude.
Worship the goddess if you would have success on the battlefield, or in the bedroom!
A satrapy is a kingdom in all but name.

Ships from far away lands bring necessities and luxuries to trade.
The earth-mother protects her children.
Weapon practice for soldiers is essential if oaths are to be fulfilled.

You can miss 1000 times if it leads to that one perfect shot…
When all is recorded and remembered, society can be organised.
Salt is worth more than gold.
The cure for anything is salt water: sweat, tears or the sea.
'The One Who Writes' watches over the faithful.
To gain a little you must give much.
Reitia helps those who listen to her wisdom, and honour her correctly.
Argument and debate may grow heated, but in that fire knowledge is forged.

Astarte is goddess of war and love, but not necessarily at the same time!
The rising sun and light of dawn bring renewal every day.
A herd provides more than food.
The city is the heart of a people, where culture and learning flourish.
Deep tunnels and shafts to access rich veins of ore.
You may laugh, you may cry. It may change your life. No refunds.
Drydocks enable speedy production of even the greatest warships.
Constant practice makes every shot deadly on the battlefield.
The dead wait, and the living should remember them.
The proper sacrifice will gain the god's favour when the red mist of war comes.
Thought must be tested, and sometimes found wanting, by considered debate.
Non-citizens must be properly organised if they are to serve Rome effectively.
Organising a fleet is easy when all military minds are together.
Unworked stone for buildings, monuments, and temples.
Worked stone for monuments and other permanent structures.
Improving the land always improves the harvest.
From the bowels of the earth come these glittering treasures.
Large grain pits from which the masses might be fed.
All honour to the daughter of Jupiter, and to her wisdom in all matters!
The knowledge of an entire people is kept here.
One can easily get lost here.
A city riots without bread, but it dies without water.
A place to meet, chat and share a sponge…
Citizens, subject troops, conscripts and levies muster here for drill and war.
A shrine to honoured ancestors and rulers, and a reminder of history.
A place of bones, where the dead return to the elements.
Water management, to power mining and reveal ore veins.
The bones of the ancestors should be properly reverenced.
Wrestling may hone the reflexes, but it also sharpens the mind.
The gods favour men who can craft wood and iron to cunning purpose.
A good harvest can bring many rewards.
A safeguard of history and philosophy through the ages.
Andraste watches over our warriors and keeps them safe in times of war.

The potter's art is a valuable one.
Permanent quarters can lead to better equipped, better trained soldiers.
The coin becomes whatever its bearer requires.
Ancestors should be treated with proper veneration.
Thunaraz! Bringer of plenty and protector of the people!
Farms and small estates provide for the majority of the people.
Ale is not a solitary pursuit!
The 'Horned One' blesses the endeavours of those who work the land.
If you eat or drink almost anything, the chances are it came from an amphora.
Where land does not allow farming, ranching is the best option.
There are places where the gods once walked.
Nodens brings forth the bounty of the forests.

Tunnelling for metals such as lead, tin, and silver.

The tower will keep out many unwanted visitors.

Feathers, fur or claws: all can be purchased…
Give blessings to Goitosyros, and welcome the light.

The day-to-day business of politics, enacted here.

Large scale mining, cutting into hills and valley-sides.

The underworld; a little dark, a little gloomy. Full of dead people.

Seek the light of truth.

Built in the image of its mother city, now superior in wealth and order.

Hic!
